sen.j: 石匙(いしさじ)とは、黒曜石や頁岩、チャートなどで作った打製石器の一種。
sen.e: Ishisaji is a kind of chipped stone tool made of obsidian, shale, chert, etc.
Ishisaji is a kind of chipped stone tool made of obsidian, shale, chert, etc.
Ishisaji is a kind of chipped stone tool made of obsidian, shale, chert, etc.

sen.j: 原石を打ち欠いてできたかけら（剥片）より製作した剥片石器。
sen.e: It is a flake tool created from a fragment (flake) removed by percussion from raw stone.
It is a flake stone tool made from a fragment (flake) obtained by striking off from a core stone.
sen.cmt: created→maderemoved by percussion from raw stone→obtained by striking off from a core stone
sen.e: It is a flake stone tool made from a fragment (flake) obtained by striking off from a core stone.

sen.j: 剥片の両端が打ち砕かれ、つまみ状の突出部が作られている。
sen.e: The flake is broken off at both ends to form a handle-like projection.
The flake is broken off at both sides to form a handle-like projection.
sen.cmt: ends→sides 形状から見た限り、「一方の端が」：One end of the flake is broken off at both sides to form a handle-like projection.とするとわかりやすいような気がします。
sen.e: The flake is broken at both ends to form a handle-like projection.

sen.j: 「匙（さじ）」の名称はその形状に由来し、江戸時代の考古・金石学研究において木内石亭が「天狗の飯匕（めしかい）」の俗称を紹介したことに始まっている。
sen.e: The name "saji" (spoon) came from its shape, and began to be used after Sekitei KIUCHI introduced its popular name, "rice spoon of tengu (a mountain spirit, portrayed as winged and having a long nose)," in his archaeological and epigraphical studies in the Edo period.

The name 'saji' (spoon) came from its shape, and began to be used by Sekitei KIUCHI who introduced a popular name, 'rice spoon of tengu (a mountain spirit, portrayed as winged and having a long nose),' to refer to this type of stone tool in his archaeological and epigraphical studies in the Edo period.
sen.cmt: after→ by 「天狗の飯匕（めしかい）」の俗称を紹介した：introduced a popular name, 'rice spoon...,'to refer to this type of stone tool
sen.e: The name 'saji' (spoon) came from its shape, and began to be used by Sekitei KIUCHI who introduced a popular name, 'rice spoon of tengu (a mountain spirit, portrayed as winged and having a long nose),' to refer to this type of stone tool in his archaeological and epigraphical studies in the Edo period.

sen.j: 明治期に神田孝平が「石匙」の呼称を用いて、中谷治宇二郎が体系的な研究を行う。
sen.e: In the Meiji period, Takahira KANDA used the name "ishisaji" and Jiujiro NAKAYA conducted systematic study of it.
In the Meiji period, Takahira KANDA used the term 'ishisaji' in his study, and Jiujiro NAKAYA conducted a systematic study of it.
sen.cmt: name→term...in his studysystematic study → a systematic study
sen.e: In the Meiji period, Takahira KANDA used the term 'ishisaji' in his study, and Jiujiro NAKAYA conducted a systematic study of it.

sen.j: しかし、スプーンとして用いられたものではないことは明らかであり、一部に「石匙」の呼称を変更すべきとの意見もある。
sen.e: But it is obvious that it was not being used as a spoon, so some people insist the name "ishisaji" should be changed.
But it is obvious that it was not used as a spoon, therefore, some scholars insist the name 'ishisaji' should be changed.

sen.j: 縄文時代から弥生時代にかけて見られ、縄文草創期に出現し、早期には普及する。
sen.e: Ishisaji was seen from the Jomon to Yayoi periods, first appearing in the incipient Jomon period and becoming widespread in the early Jomon period.

Ishisaji is a type of stone tool made during the Jomon to Yayoi periods (from about 14,000BC to 300 AD), with the first appearance in the incipient Jomon period and it was widespread in the early Jomon period.
sen.cmt: was seen from Jomon to Yayoi periods→is a type of stone tool made during the Jomon to Yayoi periods (from about 14,000BC to 300 AD)first appearing→with the first appearanceand becoming widespread →and it was widespread
sen.e: Ishisaji is a type of stone tool made during the Jomon to Yayoi periods (from about 14,000BC to 300 AD), with the first appearance in the incipient Jomon period and it was widespread in the early Jomon period.

sen.j: 地域的には東北地方に偏在し、朝鮮半島南部からも出土する。
sen.e: In terms of regional distribution, they were concentrated mainly in Tohoku region and have also been discovered in southern part of Korean Peninsula.
Although most of the articles have been excavated in Tohoku region, some has been discovered in the Korean Peninsula.
sen.cmt: In terms of regional distribution, ' を使わない構文にしました。
sen.e: Although most of the articles have been excavated in Tohoku region, some has been discovered in the Korean Peninsula.

sen.j: 用途は使用痕の観察から動物の皮や肉、角や骨など動物質の加工や、木や蔦など植物質の加工など、一種の携帯万能ナイフとして用いたと考えられている。
sen.e: According to the observation of traces of usage, ishisaji are thought to have been used as a kind of portable utility knife to process skin, meat, horns, bone and other animal parts and to treat plant materials such as trees and ivy.

According to the traces of how they were used, ishisaji is thought to have been used as a kind of portable utility knife to process skin, meat, horns, bone and other animal parts as well as to treat plant materials such as trees and ivy.
sen.cmt: According to the observation of traces of usage→According to the traces of how they were used,ishisaji are thought →ishisaji is thoughtand to treat →as well as to treat
sen.e: According to the traces of how they were used, ishisaji is thought to have been used as a kind of portable utility knife to process skin, meat, horns, bone and other animal parts as well as to treat plant materials such as trees and ivy.

sen.j: 突出部に紐や天然アスファルトが付着して出土した例があり、また石匙を身につけたまま埋葬された例もある。
sen.e: Judging from the facts that the unearthed ishisaji retained the string and natural asphalt on its protrusion and that people were buried wearing ishisaji, people probably tied the string around ishisaji so that they could carry it around their neck or waist, thereby, as Yoshiya UENO considers, showing individual ownership.
When excavated, some of the unearthed ishisaji retained a string or a clod of natural asphalt on its projected part, and some excavated bodies were wearing ishisaji.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処When excavated, で始まる文章にしました。
sen.e: When excavated, some of the unearthed ishisaji retained a string or a clod of natural asphalt on its projected part, and some excavated bodies were wearing ishisaji.

sen.j: これらのことから、紐を巻きつけて首にかけたり腰にまいたりして持ちはこんだと考えられており、上野佳也は個人所有を明確にしていたと位置づけている
sen.e: These facts suggest that people probably were carrying ishisaji around their neck or waist by tying the string around it, and Yoshiya UENO positions it as a manifestation of individual ownership.

sen.e: These facts suggest that people probably were carrying ishisaji around their neck or waist by tying the string around it, and Yoshiya UENO positions it as a manifestation of individual ownership.
